result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9:54 AM Defendant Megan M. Buck in court.  Attorney Joseph Michael Freier in court for Megan M. Buck.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin. State orally amends count 1 to OWI 3rd with alcohol fine enhancer. Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1, 2, and 5. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1, 2, and 5. Counts 3, 4, and 6 are dismissed and read in. On count 1, Court orders 9 months jail with full Huber. Drivers license revoked for 3 years and IID for 3 years. Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.  A fine of $5400 plus costs due within 60 days. Court orders no penalties on counts 2 and 5. Sentence credit 1 day. Warrant vacated.
Return on warrant on October 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.
JPD

8:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Megan M. Buck appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,500.00 with conditions: Cannot operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, without insurance or after consuming any intoxicants or without an IID device. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10AM.
